poem:
Save Blackwater River  

a river's quiet  
whisper, unheard—  
until we stand,  
a community  
in murmur and shout,  

against the spill  
of politics,  
guardians of clear flow.  

let the water run  
free and ancient,  
unburdened by  
human design,  
for both man  
and fish must drink.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Success for local residents as Florida council toppled over sewage plant plan A citizens’ revolt in a small Florida city ousted an entire slate of councilors who were pushing for a new sewage plant to be built close to one of the state’s most pristine and treasured rivers. The Save Blackwater River campaign, in partnership with a citizen action group, toppled all four Milton politicians running for re-election last month in a remarkable victory for". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
